chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L. Leider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from DOC with Letter to Judge Kussel

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF74, 15CT34, 15CF176 and 11CF192.  Called at 3:17 pm.  Plea agreement  14CF74 plea to Ct 1 & 6.  15CF176 plea to count. WIthdraw NGI.  Upon pleas being entered. state moves to dismiss and read in 15CT34 and balance of counts in 14CF74, Ct 2,3,4 & 5.  Plea questionnaire filed and reviewed.  Def will plea no contest to Ct 1 & 6 in 14CF74 and 15CF176.  Constitutional rights, charges and penalties  reviewed.  Elements reviewed. Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Other counts dimissed and read in.  Def acknowledges previous felony conviction.  State gives sentence recommendations.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Plea accecpt and found guilty.  Sentencing arguments by State.  11CF192 Credit of 419 days and 14CF74 4 days credit if revoked.  Atty Morgan presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  11CF192 Ct 5, Court orders 6 yr prison 2 yrs intitial conf and 4 yrs extended supervison.  Concurrent with present term.  Follow all recommendation of probation  Credit 419 days.  15CF176 Ct 1 - Sentence 6 months incarceration  Consecutive to prison term.  DNA surcharge and sample  14CF74 Ct 1 - Sentence withheld 2 yrs probation.  Follow rules of probation.    Ct 6 - Sentence withheld 3 yrs probation  Follow standard rules of probation.  Cost on both.  11CF192 Def is eligible for challenge inc.   Felony convictions reviewed.  14CF74 credit of 4 days if revoked.  Post convictions rights.  Statement by Atty Morgan.  Response by State.   Def is also eligilbe for substance abuse program  11CF192 - cost to be paid    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Rhode also present.  14CF74, 15CT34 Judge Kuessell cases, 11CF192 and 15CF176 Judge Rhode's cases.  Off record discussion.  Counsel and def agree to Judge Kussell hearing all cases. Matter to be adjourned until later to see if parties can reached an agreement.  Bond will continue

see 11CF192

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court via video with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Shawn Michael Behrens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CT34 and 14CF74 @ 3:05 p.m. 15CT34 Atty Morgan has reviewed complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court advises Counsel to call judicial assistants on 12/22/15 to schedule for status conf. 14CF74 - Statement regarding status of case. State asks both matters be scheduled for status conf. in Langlade Co. on 2/8/16 @ 3:30. Court orders. Def does not have to appear. Bond set. Adj. 3:14 Recalled 3:16 - Both cases will be called on 2/8/16.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance at 12-18-2015 03:00 pm

Attorney Andrew M. Morgan in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CT34 and 14CF74 @ 3:19 p.m. Defendant is not present. Atty Morgan only represents Def on 15CT34, does not know why Def does not appear. Notice was sent. State requests Def be ordered to appear at next hrg. Court will appear by telephone for an adjourned initial appearance if parties agree. Court orders Def must appear at adjourned initial appearance which will be scheduled. Atty Morgan to notify Defendant. 14CF74 Atty Morgan will contact PD office to see if he can be appointed on this case, which will track along as status conference. Off the record for scheduling 3:28 p.m. 3:30 - Counsel to contact JA to schedule. Any bonds in effect, remain.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not Guilty plea entered to all counts.  Court will accept not guilty pleas.  Motions and jury instructions to be filed 5 days prior to trial  Bond will continue  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Steven L. Leider in court with attorney Tara M. Guelzow.  Defendant Steven L. Leider in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:34 p.m. Stipulate prior conviction. Statement by D.A. Uttke. Dep. Andrew Strobusch duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Def.  State moves for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. State asks arraignment to proceed today. Atty Guelzow requests arraignment at future date.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
